title: The first head of the laboratory was M.G. Tartakovskii, a veterinary doctor, who was appointed to oversee the production of anti-plague sera in horses. He was succeeded by another veterinarian V.I. Turchinovich-Vyzhnekevich who died on 7 January 1904 after contracting plague during a laboratory experiment. His successor A.I. Berestnev was director until 1908 when he was succeeded by I.Z. Shurupov (also a veterinary doctor). From 1916 until its closure in 1918, A.I. Berdnikov served as director. Turchinovich-Vyzhnekevich was not the only researcher to contract a laboratory infection within the fort
